sourceOrganization.name: NIAID CREID Network
sourceOrganization.abstract: The Centers for Research in Emerging Infectious Diseases (CREID) Network is a global consortium of research centers focused on studying emerging and re-emerging infectious diseases in regions prone to outbreaks. These centers conduct surveillance, research, and response efforts to better mitigate future infectious disease threats.
sourceOrganization.description: The Centers for Research in Emerging Infectious Diseases (CREID) Network is a coordinated group of emerging infectious disease research centers situated in regions around the globe where emerging and re-emerging infectious disease outbreaks are likely to occur. For more information, visit the NIAID program page: https://www.niaid.nih.gov/research/centers-research-emerging-infectious-diseases
